alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Lavaca (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 12:57AM CST until January 27 at 9:51AM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Houston/Galveston TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Trinity River near Moss Bluff affecting Chambers and Liberty Counties. Navidad River at Strane Park affecting Jackson County. Navidad River near Speaks affecting Jackson and Lavaca Counties. Lavaca River near Edna affecting Jackson County. For the Trinity River...including Moss Bluff...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Navidad River...including Speaks, Strane Park...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Lavaca River...including Edna...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Navidad River near Speaks. * WHEN...Until late Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 28.0 feet, Major lowland flooding begins with the river several hundred yards wide in the vicinity of the gauge. Approaches to the FM 530 bridge are flooded and impassable. Much of the floodplain is cut off endangering livestock. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 AM CST Thursday the stage was 21.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 21.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage early this morning to 28.4 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening to 6.1 feet Saturday evening. It will rise to 10.8 feet Sunday evening. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 28.2 feet on 04/19/2009. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 am CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Navidad River Speaks 24.0 21.4 Thu 12 am CS 28.1 23.1 6.8 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 700 PM CST.
